title: What is Gray hiding in EastEnders as the domestic abuse storyline continues?
text:
Gray has displayed abusive and controlling behaviour (Picture: BBC)

EastEnders’ Gray Atkins (Toby-Alexander Smith) could find himself in trouble after he faces questioning over a violent altercation in scenes to come.

While Gray and his pregnant wife Chantelle (Jessica Plummer) seem to have it all from the outside, behind closed doors it’s a very different and sinister story.

What is Gray hiding in EastEnders?

Gray has been physically abusing Chantelle for a number of months and has recently threatened to kill her again.

As well as being violent, Gray has also displayed controlling behaviour determining how much time she is to spend with friends and how much money she can spend.

Gary’s wife Chantelle is pregnant with the couple’s first child (Picture: BBC)

What’s going to happen to Gray in EastEnders?

Actor Toby-Alexander Smith, who plays Gray, has hinted the soap will delve further into the character’s dark persona and expose more of his toxic behaviour in the coming months.

He told The Mirror: It’s very difficult for me to identify with the character but I have to find ways of doing that and finding humanity in Gray because he is very layered.

‘He isn’t just that monster, there is a reason the way he is and it stems from a lot of toxic influence we will go on to explore.’

Smith explained the couple’s pregnancy has provided motivation for his character to change, however that will come down to whether he’s willing to lose his sense of entitlement.

The actor added: ‘There’s a very insecure side to Gray and it’s a fear of losing the things he needs around him.’

Warning: The following video includes scenes of domestic violence.

EastEnders is next on tonight, 10 October, at 7:30pm on BBC One.
